intro: Onosma cyrenaica subsp. straussii, commonly known as the Strauß's tansy, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. It is often found in coastal areas and arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its ornamental value makes it a sought-after plant in gardens and botanical collections.
